Description:
ACCOUNTABILITIESEnsure Engineering Dossier are delivered with a robust Pipeline engineering definition and fit for purpose design that can be procured, fabricated, transported, installed, and operated safely, meeting the requirements of the organization's standard, project basis of design, and SOR. 
Ensure assigned project tasks are well managed in accordance with the project execution plan and contractual requirements that includes:
Thorough, efficient, and timely review of project Pipeline discipline documents, realization of potential derogations to the standards, and challenge the design to achieve an optimize and fit for purpose outcome
Assisting to project studies and meetings related to the Pipeline discipline as per project approved gate levels and design maturity 
Identifying potential risks and scope changes, conducting initial impact assessment to provide detailed information to Pipeline lead. ACTIVITIESEnsure Engineering Dossier delivered with a robust Pipeline engineering definition and fit for purpose design that can be procured, fabricated, transported, installed, and operated safely, meeting the requirements of the organization's standard, project basis of design, and SOR. Ensure and coordinate the proper realization of the Pipeline design in compliance with the organization's Standard, project specifications and procedures, time schedule, required level of quality and safety
Challenge EPCIC Contractor on the proposed design, oversee the development of the Pipeline design including, Pipeline studies and analysis, alignment sheets, crossing details and calculations, installation procedures and plans and etc.
Promote field technical optimization/cost savings for offshore pipe laying and crossing execution, ensuring first that they are compliant with the project schedule and the contracts, liaising with the Pipeline Engineering Coordinator.
Identify Pipeline engineering technical decisions to be made. Define and manage clear way forward for these decisions to be made and report to Pipeline Engineering Coordinator.
Ensure close coordination with other disciplines on all engineering, constructability and operational matters,
Ensure that relevant feedback/lesson learned from previous similar projects are considered in the design performance.
Assist in planning and preparation of Pipeline discipline kick-off meeting with EPC Contractor
Support procurement engineering including TBEs and vendor documents review, and assist in manufacture site visit 
Support fabrication and construction engineering on review of engineering documents, modification approval, non-conformity reviews and assist in closer of punch lists
Support project during installation stage and review/approval work-pack, review of red-marks Thorough, efficient, and timely review of project Pipeline discipline documents, realization of potential derogations to the standards, and challenge the design to achieve an optimize and fit for purpose outcomeEnsure project documents related to the Pipeline discipline are reviewed and commented in a timely manner and in accordance with the organization's standards, project specification and contractual requirements.
Identify any optimization / improvement in the design dossier to be implemented in the early stage of detailed design, promote, and encourage submissions of value engineering proposals.
Promote fit for purpose design to reduce and to optimize planning and costs,
Coordinate and issue project response to contractors and vendors requests on engineering design clarifications and TQR.
Identify the protentional deviations/derogations to the organization to and assist in preparation of deviation package
Consult E&C department to Pipeline derogation requests and interface with relevant TRP to secure needed approvals
Review of final project documentation including final dossiers and as-built drawings.Assisting to project studies and meetings related to the Pipeline discipline as per project approved gate levels and design maturityAssist Pipeline Engineering Coordinator to define, follow up and evaluate the Pipeline discipline studies to be carried out by Contractors, ensure the studies completed as per approved project gate and maturity. 
Assist in preparation and attend to project studies including model review, HAZID, HAZOP, constructability review, PRs.
Provide technical answers and clarifications to internal project audit sessions (PR, HAZOP, HAZID, etc.…).
Participate in weekly Pipeline engineering meetings with Contractors, and in specific ad hoc meetings as required by management.
Manage the technical interfaces with other disciplines such as welding, coating, NDE, installation etc. for the preparation of pipelines scope of work.
Assist in preparation of engineering progress reports detailing Pipeline discipline progress across schedule. risks and technical issues to ensure accurate and timely information available to Package Management Team Identifying potential risks and scope changes within the Pipeline discipline, conducting initial impact assessment to provide detailed information to Pipeline Lead.Identify potential engineering scope change related to Pipeline discipline, carry out initial technical assessment in order to provide accurate information to Pipeline Lead.
Ensure the design follows the approved SOR, basis of design and project standards, captured and manage any changes as per project change management plan. CONTEXT AND ENVIRONMENTThe scope of activities will concern green field (new development), brownfield activities (on existing platforms) and integration works. The activities include the review and comment of engineering and vendor documentation to ensure compliance with design dossier, SOR, Company specifications, …
Major Projects involve the development of new offshore platforms, integration to the existing facilities, installation of subsea pipelines, debottlenecking of existing functions, all these activities will be executed across several international sites. Projects involves complex interfaces with other entities of the organization. 
Engineering development take place EPCIC Engineering premises and then project team will move to fabrication yard of the Contractor.
Possibility of multiple worldwide missions or relocations to follow-up engineering development with various contractors.Skills
Skills:
Qualification: Engineering degree qualification (Mechanical or Civil)
Senior engineer with a good level of technical understanding of all relevant technical disciplines, with at least 10 years’ experience of pipeline engineering on offshore oil & gas projects.
Operational Experience of offshore pipeline installation is a plus
Strong leadership skills and good communication skills.
Good analytical skills.
Familiar with Total general specifications is a plus, and with relevant codes and standards,
Language: fluent English,
Ability to work on projects in a complex and multicultural environment.
